2021-05-01.text: I am so deeply sorry for your loss.

2021-04-04.text: My parents haven't even met their granddaughter who is now 16 months old. And now we have to wait another four months between doses? I'm tired. And sad. Please stop changing the goal posts.

2021-03-23.text: I don't know you, but I am happy for you. Enjoy the rewards that come with your decision.

2021-01-30.text: Saint Maybe by Anne Tyler. My favorite professor introduced it to me way back in the day, and I keep going back.

2021-01-17.text: Do your part to protect others. Get your flu shot. https://t.co/0hO6h221VB

2021-01-09.text: I seem to recall he was encouraged by his Auntie  in this regard. Of course, mommy and daddy were okay to turn a blind eye. 📚❤

2021-01-07.text: It just makes me so sad for my son. We've been following the guidelines since day one - my parents haven't even met my baby girl who turned 1 in Dec - and it just feels like we're all alone in our efforts as a family. My heart hurts.

2021-01-06.text: You are so kind to take the time to respond. Thank YOU for being such a strong healthcare advocate and valuing social justice. I am grateful that I can point out people like you to my children as examples of what it means to be good and kind.
Thank you! That is so kind of you.
Just when you think you you've reached your breaking point and you feel entirely alone, a complete stranger gives you the necessary encouragement to keep going. https://t.co/5xe3mzsQX3

This actually means a great deal. My parents on the east coast still have not met their granddaughter and she turned a year in December. It's been so hard mothering in isolation, and feeling so alone in your efforts to follow the rules to boot. So thank you.

2020-12-22.text: This is happening in Toronto. Do the right thing this holiday season. #wenotme https://t.co/Iu4PzzFx6v

2020-12-17.text: Not too harsh at all. Calling on people to exercise care and compassion for others shouldn't be that difficult. #StayHome https://t.co/61vJRyolD7

2020-12-14.text: This. You don't have to "give up" Christmas. Channel some of that holiday spirit and take care of each other. The best gift you can give is loving your neighbour. #CovidChristmas2020 #StayAtHome https://t.co/8BGPhHSsry

2020-12-07.text: You should take a stroll through my neighbourhood on any given day. Folks here have been playing loose with public health guidelines since the very beginning. It leaves me feeling quite despondent.

2020-11-30.text: You likely won't read this, but your statement means everything to this mama who struggled with PPD and was beating myself up for having to switch to formula. I burst into tears reading this. Thank you.

2020-10-25.text: We gave up our bubble when we sent our son back to school. And so Thanksgiving was another "baby's first" for our daughter as we spent it alone. My parents on the east coast haven't even met her. So frustrated doing the right thing when no one else seems to give a damn.

2020-10-20.text: The playing field certainly isn't even. I am frustrated daily by my own neighbourhood where folks have been playing cute with the rules since day one. And they will no doubt be yelling the loudest when it comes to Halloween because of their privilege.
You should take a walk through my neighbourhood...folks here have been playing loose with public health guidelines since day one.

2020-10-06.text: My parents on the east coast still haven't met my baby girl (we're in Toronto). It's been a year of heartbreak.

You are everything that is wrong with the world. My 8 year old son has more compassion than you - he understands that wearing a mask is caring about others. Also to equate feminity as weakness (purse comment) is just gross and a slap in the face to women.

2020-10-04.text: Keep fighting on behalf of those who can't fight for themselves. The world needs less critics and more folks like you.
